document.docAuthor: Guanilo, Alberto Daniel, Moraes, Gilberto José De, Toledo, Silvana & Knapp, Markus
document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Argentina, with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from Argentina, with description of a new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Phytoseiulus fragariae
Denmark & Schicha 1983
: 34
;
Moraes et al . 1986
: 108
; 1991 : 132 ; 2004 : 167 ;
Chant & McMurtry 2006
: 20
; 2007 : 55 ; Guanilo et al . in press .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined. Tucumán : San Miguel de Tucumán – Portal La Virginia (
26 ° 42 ' 41.4 ''S
,
64 ° 57 ' 44.5 ''W
),
15 -V- 2007
, on
Nicotiana glauca
( 1 Ψ); San Miguel de Tucumán – Vipos (
26 ° 28 ' 34.2 ''S
,
65 ° 18 ' 42.3 ''W
),
15 -V- 2007
, on
Nicandra physaloides
( 1 Ψ).

;

subSubSection.paragraph:
Amblyseius ( Mesoseiulus ) longipes
, van der Merwe 1968 : 1474 – 175 .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

Gonzalez & Schuster 1962
: 18
;

: 66
;

: 49
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. No additional specimens of this species were found in this study.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Phytoseiulus macropilis ,
Schuster & Pritchard 1963
: 279
; McMurtry 1983 : 259 ;
Moraes et al . 1986
: 108
; 2000 : 249 ; 2004 : 167 ;
Takahashi & Chant 1993
: 28
;
Chant & McMurtry 2006
: 20
; 2007 : 55 ; Guanilo et al . in press .

Phytoseiulus chanti
Ehara 1966 b
: 135
(synonymy by
Denmark & Muma 1973
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsal shield 344 ( 338-350 ) long and 199 ( 190–208 ) wide; j 1 25 ( 24–25 ), j 3 37 ( 34–39 ), j 4 45 ( 36–57 ), j 5 53 ( 45–63 ), j 6 141 ( 132–154 ), J 5 4 ( 3–4 ), z 2 12 ( 9–15 ), z 4 58 ( 50–65 ), z 5 9 ( 8–9 ), Z 1 103 ( 97–108 ), Z 4 121 ( 116–125 ), Z 5 112 ( 110–115 ), s 4 171 ( 165–175 ), S 5 32 ( 27–39 ), r 3 21 ( 18–23 ), R 1 20 ( 15–25 ); distances between st 1 -st 3 67 ( 65–68 ), st 2 -st 2 73 ( 68–75 ) and st 5 -st 5 87 ( 80–95 ); ventri-anal shield 87 ( 85–88 ) long and 80 ( 78–83 ) wide at level of anus; with 1 pair of pre-anal setae (JV 2 ); JV 5 37 ( 31–40 ); peritreme extending to level between setae z 4 and s 4 ; movable cheliceral digit 23 long, with 3 teeth; fixed cheliceral digit 25 long, with 7 teeth; calyx of spermatheca 33 ( 32–33 ); Sge
IV 72
( 64–78 ), Sti
IV 35
( 31–41 ), St IV 108 ( 95–120 ). Chaetotaxy: genu II 2 , 2/ 1-2 /0, 1; genu III 1 , 2/ 1-2 /0, 1.

Specimens examined. Salta : Metán – Crestón (
25 ° 29 ' 25.3 ''S
,
64 ° 58 ' 28.10 ''W
),
12 -V- 2007
, on
Vassobia breviflora
( 2 Ψ); on
Nicotiana glauca
( 1 Ψ, 4 immatures). Tucumán : San Miguel de Tucumán – Vipos (
26 ° 28 ' 34.2 ''S
,
65 ° 18 ' 42.3 ''W
),
15 -V- 2007
, on
Salpichroa origanifolia
( 1 Ψ); on
Solanum melongena
( 1 Ψ); on
Nicandra physaloides
( 9 Ψ).

Remarks. Some of the specimens collected had only one pre-anal seta (the corresponding seta of the opposite side was off the shield). This type of variation was also reported for specimens from Guatemala (McMurtry 1983 ) and Peru (Guanilo et al . in press ).
